summary: This bill, the Supreme Court Tenure Establishment and Retirement Modernization Act of 2025, proposes changes to the terms and appointment process for Supreme Court justices. It mandates an 18-year term for each justice, with staggered appointments every other year following presidential elections. The bill also outlines procedures for Senate confirmations and addresses scenarios involving retired justices. Finally, it modifies existing law regarding senior justices and their potential recall to active service in specific circumstances.
